definition: good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
to make friends/(dialect) to start an affair with sb
one depends on one's parents when at home, and on one's friends when away from home (idiom)
pinyin: zai4 jia1 kao4 fu4 mu3 , chu1 wai4 kao4 peng2 you5
containing_words.word: 在家靠父母，出外靠朋友

definition: one depends on one's parents when at home, and on one's friends when away from home (idiom)
pinyin: zai4 jia1 kao4 fu4 mu3 , chu1 men2 kao4 peng2 you5
containing_words.word: 在家靠父母，出门靠朋友

definition: the more friends you have, the more options you have in life (idiom)
pinyin: duo1 ge4 peng2 you3 duo1 tiao2 lu4

definition: Moments (social networking function of smartphone app WeChat 微信[Wei1 xin4])
you should not covet your friend's wife (idiom)
pinyin: peng2 you5 qi1 bu4 ke3 qi1

sentences.english: Blaine stopped to chat with a friend and Guiteau saw his chance.
sentences.chinese: 布莱恩停下来跟一位朋友聊天，吉特奥看到了机会。

sentences.english: Blair: Well, lucky for you, your friend is someone I actually care about.
sentences.chinese: 算你走运，你的那位朋友碰巧是我挺在乎的一个人。

sentences.english: A ghost is following your girlfriend.
After that, people call on their relatives, friends and neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 在那之后，人们给亲戚，朋友和邻居拜年。

sentences.english: I met a lot of friends, a lot of people from a lot around the world.
sentences.chinese: 我碰到很多朋友，很多人，他们来自世界各地。

sentences.english: I love to meet up with my friends, get out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢和朋友们聚在一起，离开城市的喧嚣。

sentences.english: It was fine at first; most of my friends had moved home too.
sentences.chinese: 起初我觉得还好，我的很多朋友也都回家投靠父母了。

sentences.english: Friendship and play shorten the day.
sentences.chinese: 好朋友，共游玩，日子过得欢。

sentences.english: Tom's friend said he was a double-tongued liar.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的朋友说他是个两面三刀的骗子。

sentences.english: He has three good friends, such as Mary , Jhon.
sentences.chinese: 他有三个好朋友，如玛丽和约翰。

sentences.english: Chinese mainland part of the film and television industry friends want to shoot some students in my class.
sentences.chinese: 中国大陆几个影视界的朋友想让我班部分同学拍戏。

sentences.english: Nick: Excuse me. Do you know Xie Lei? I'm his friend from America.
sentences.chinese: 对不起。你认识谢磊吗？我是他美国的朋友。

sentences.english: The Bible tells us to forgive our enemies; not our friends. – Margot Asquith.
sentences.chinese: 圣经告诉我原谅我们的敌人，但没说要原谅朋友。

sentences.english: Women get off on judging each other, especially their very own friends.
sentences.chinese: 女人天性心爱品论他人，特别是评论自己的好朋友。

sentences.english: The old house was soon crowded with relatives and Grandpa's friends.
sentences.chinese: 老屋里很快挤满了亲戚和爷爷的朋友。

definition: good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
close friend/pal/(social networking website) friend/CL:個|个[ge4]
to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
Moments (social networking function of smartphone app WeChat 微信[Wei1 xin4])
old friend/sb who passed the county level imperial exam (in Ming dynasty)
to share (let others have some of sth good)
